rev.comment: more clear text about "carrying portable apps" (in image caption)
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:USB flash drive.jpg|thumb|right|A [[USB flash drive|USB drive]] can carry portable applications]]
+
[[Image:USB flash drive.jpg|thumb|right|A [[USB flash drive|USB drive]] can carry portable applications, and they can run directly from it]]
A '''portable application''' ('''portable app''') is a [[computer]] [[software program]] that runs from a removable storage device such as a [[CD-ROM]] drive, [[USB flash drive]], [[flash memory|flash card]], or [[floppy disk]]. ''Portable apps'' should not be confused with ''[[porting|software portability]]'' where software allows its [[source code]] to be [[compiler|compiled]] for different [[computing platform]]s. Portable applications can be run on any computer system with which they are compatible but typically require a specific [[operating system]] such as [[Microsoft Windows]] XP or above, any GNU/Linux, etc.
A '''portable application''' ('''portable app''') is a [[computer]] [[software program]] that runs from a removable storage device such as a [[CD-ROM]] drive, [[USB flash drive]], [[flash memory|flash card]], or [[floppy disk]]. ''Portable apps'' should not be confused with ''[[porting|software portability]]'' where software allows its [[source code]] to be [[compiler|compiled]] for different [[computing platform]]s. Portable applications can be run on any computer system with which they are compatible but typically require a specific [[operating system]] such as [[Microsoft Windows]] XP or above, any GNU/Linux, etc.
